link.script: /* CSS Browser Selector v0.4.0 (Nov 02, 2010) Can apply styles to specific browsers, this js adds a class to body tag based on browser Rafael Lima (http://rafael.adm.br) http://rafael.adm.br/css_browser_selector License: http://creativecommons.org/licenses/by/2.5/ Contributors: http://rafael.adm.br/css_browser_selector#contributors */ function css_browser_selector(u) { var ua = u.toLowerCase(), is = function (t) { return ua.indexOf(t) > -1 }, g = 'gecko', w = 'webkit', s = 'safari', o = 'opera', m = 'mobile', h = document.documentElement, b = [(!(/opera|webtv/i.test(ua)) && /msie\s(\d)/.test(ua)) ? ('ie ie' + RegExp.$1) : is('firefox/2') ? g + ' ff2' : is('firefox/3.5') ? g + ' ff3 ff3_5' : is('firefox/3.6') ? g + ' ff3 ff3_6' : is('firefox/3') ? g + ' ff3' : is('gecko/') ? g : is('opera') ? o + (/version\/(\d+)/.test(ua) ? ' ' + o + RegExp.$1 : (/opera(\s|\/)(\d+)/.test(ua) ? ' ' + o + RegExp.$2 : '')) : is('konqueror') ? 'konqueror' : is('blackberry') ? m + ' blackberry' : is('android') ? m + ' android' : is('chrome') ? w + ' chrome' : is('iron') ? w + ' iron' : is('applewebkit/') ? w + ' ' + s + (/version\/(\d+)/.test(ua) ? ' ' + s + RegExp.$1 : '') : is('mozilla/') ? g : '', is('j2me') ? m + ' j2me' : is('iphone') ? m + ' iphone' : is('ipod') ? m + ' ipod' : is('ipad') ? m + ' ipad' : is('mac') ? 'mac' : is('darwin') ? 'mac' : is('webtv') ? 'webtv' : is('win') ? 'win' + (is('windows nt 6.0') ? ' vista' : '') : is('freebsd') ? 'freebsd' : (is('x11') || is('linux')) ? 'linux' : '', 'js']; c = b.join(' '); h.className += ' ' + c; return c; }; css_browser_selector(navigator.userAgent);

input.name: __VIEWSTATE

li.a: K-6 Standards Based Report Card Information

strong.span: More updates will be posted as information becomes available.

span.div: We are going to continue with the plan that was released on April 22.

div.span: Seniors, please read this message from Mr. Thompson, Superintendent of Piqua City Schools.

Governor DeWine announced that all Ohio schools will be closed to students for the remainder of this school year. We will continue with our current format of providing lessons to our students throughout the rest of 2019-2020 school calendar year.

span.div: Upper Valley Career Center Parking Lot

h3.a: Financial Assistance for Those Who Qualify (April 18, 2020)

span.span: Temporary Assistance to Needy Families who have a Child in the Household

It is important to take this time to thank you for your continued partnership with Piqua City Schools during this closure that has been orded by Governor DeWine. The Ohio Department of Education has recently released some guidelines to help with the amount of work we assign and how it can be graded under these unusual circumstances. After reviewing these guidelines and seeking input from others, we have come up with the following outline to assist us all as we sustain this important work during the school shut down period.

div.span: It is important to take this time to thank you for your continued partnership with Piqua City Schools during this closure that has been orded by Governor DeWine. The Ohio Department of Education has recently released some guidelines to help with the amount of work we assign and how it can be graded under these unusual circumstances. After reviewing these guidelines and seeking input from others, we have come up with the following outline to assist us all as we sustain this important work during the school shut down period.

span.style: color: #222222; font-family: arial, sans-serif; font-size: small; background-color: #ffffff

span.span: We are working on a process to improve our food distribution to ensure students are getting much-needed food to sustain them throughout the week. Please read these important directions so you can plan accordingly for next Monday’s food distribution. Thank you!!

span.style: color: #222222; font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: small; background-color: #ffffff

span.span: This message is to inform all parents that Governor DeWine has now officially closed K-12 public schools until May 1, 2020, due to COVID-19. We will continue our efforts to work with parents and students through home instruction as directed by the Governor and The Ohio Dept. of Education.

h3.a: Changes in Food Distribution Beginning March 30th (March 29, 2020)

span.style: color: #222222; font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: small; background-color: #ffffff

span.span: Beginning this week, we will be distributing five days’ worth of food on one day. Breakfast and lunch food items will again be distributed at PHS and PCIS. Parents and students will continue to stay in their cars and we will hand food to you. If you plan to go to PHS, please enter on Indian Trail and pull up to the second set of doors in front of the high school. You will then exit on Tomahawk Trail. PCIS food will be distributed in the back off of Camp Street as last week. Again, we will provide five days’ worth of food to each child aged 1 – 18 for free on Monday only this week beginning at noon until we run out of food.

h3.a: Updating Parent Contact Information and Email (March 29, 2020)

typing-node.span: Teachers tried to reach out to each of their students last week but have had some difficulty reaching all. If you have not been able to make a connection yet, please feel free to send an email to your child's teachers to help us make a connection so we can be a vital resource to help you out during this time. If you have changed your phone number or address, please update that information on the Parent Oneview portal located on our website at
on the top right-hand side so we can stay in touch. You can also send an email to
so we can assist you. Finally, if you need technology support in any way, please call 937-916-3150.

span.div: Saturday, March 28, 2020 at the Upper Valley Career Center Parking Lot

span.span: We will be distributing lunches at noon but have limited our locations now to 2 locations to help everyone with physical/social distancing guidelines. Lunches will now be distributed only at PHS and PCIS.

div.span:
Piqua City Schools Parents and Students,
I hope you are all doing well considering these unique times. Whereas we have never seen anything like this, I am confident in our district’s abilities to continue to be an important part of our students’ lives as well as our community. Please know that I will try to be very intentional with
